A check to verify if requested BT amount is > BT_AMT PCT Variable - typically set to $998. It will match the BXF_INST_ACCT_NUM of each BT with the DTRACCOUNT field of the bureau trade lines (CR_DMS_TR02 objects) & calculate a % match score based on the $ amount of the BTs that match account numbers with the trade lines as well as the total requested BT amount. % is stored in Capstone field - APP_BT_PCT_MTCH field on the APPLICATION. % match is compared with a new PCT variable (BT_MIN_MATCH_PCT), if the calculated match score is equal to or below the PCT variable amount then the application will flow down to 5200_ManualReview in the FRD_MetaModelReview queue.

The option for the applicant to cancel ALL BT's submitted, determined by credit policy. This is enabled in the 1st Handshake only. Credit Policy determines if this SOL/TC is eligible and sets the correct PCT variables to enable the BT cancel option. If this PCT object exists, the AppResults will include a flag signaling IAA to enable the Cancel BT option. AppResults export will be modified to include and set this flag. If the customer response from either IAA or ACS is to cancel the BT's, the BXF object decision reason is set to cancel (5) and a child object is added with a reason code of cancel (6) for the BT. Champion/Challenger is a well established methodology for validating the effectiveness of changes to Financial Institutions’ decisioning logic and risk policy. Champion/challenger testing always starts with a new idea- the challenger. It could be something small like a modified attribute. It could be something big like a whole new decisioning process for near-prime consumers. Once the challenger has been created, it needs to be tested against the champion (the current policy).

An official term for designating the highest level control document. A Policy answers the "why" (i.e. "because safety is a priority, there must be a speed limit established and posted on all roads"). Web Application Testing In Ruby - Pronounced water, WATIR is a free, open-source, functional testing tool for automating browser-based tests of Web applications. It drives the Internet Explorer browser the same way people do, such as clicking links, filling in forms and pressing buttons. WATIR also checks results, such as whether expected text appears on the page. WATIR is a Ruby library that works with Internet Explorer on Windows. Like other powerful programming languages, Ruby provides the power to connect to databases, read data files, export XML and structure code into reusable libraries. Source
